pullRequest.title: Extend and refactor sending of validation requests in Utils
pullRequest.bodyText:
new methods:

sendAccountActivationEmail
sendAccountActivationConfirmationEmail


logic is same as for password reset methods just with different text
templates for body and subject of email
refactor code of methods:

sendPasswordResetEmail
sendValidationEmail
sendPasswordResetConfirmationEmail


to prevent using duplicates of code and make it easier to use in the
future
for purpose of refactoring, these new private methods were created:

prepareValidationLinkForEmailChange
prepareValidationLinkForPasswordResetAndAccountActivation
prepareValidityTo
prepareBodyOfEmail
prepareSubjectOfEmail
sendEmail


all methods are there to prepare environment to work with such
requests

nodes.bodyText: validationLink is unused in the later code. Maybe it get mixed with linkLocation in the template?
Please update javadoc, there is no namespace and id in the method params.
Please do explicit logging in error mode for that exception. Thank you.
We must append &activation=true so that app for password reset knows, it should behave as an account activation. Or you can handle this in link preparation method.

beforeCommit.message:
Extend and refactor sending of validation requests in Utils

 - new methods:
  - sendAccountActivationEmail
  - sendAccountActivationConfirmationEmail
 - logic is same as for password reset methods just with different text
 templates for body and subject of email
 - refactor code of methods:
  - sendPasswordResetEmail
  - sendValidationEmail
  - sendPasswordResetConfirmationEmail
 - to prevent using duplicates of code and make it easier to use in the
 future
 - for purpose of refactoring, these new private methods were created:
  - prepareValidationLinkForEmailChange
  - prepareValidationLinkForPasswordResetAndAccountActivation
  - prepareValidityTo
  - prepareBodyOfEmail
  - prepareSubjectOfEmail
  - sendEmail
 - all methods are there to prepare environment to work with such
 requests

nodes.bodyText: Location of the error in the code should be visible from the stacktrace of the passed ex. I would shorten the error message like: Unable to send mail to "email". or something like this.

It remained in defaultBody as directly joined strings. Maybe you should just prepare all replacable strings first and then use placeholders (eg. {link}) also in default template body. This might apply to other mail types too.
